job.title: Software Development Engineer in Test II,
job.description: pstrongStatusstrong Full Time EmployeeppstrongJob Categorystrong Software EngineeringppstrongRelevant Work Experiencestrong 24 yearsppstrongCareer Levelstrong MidLevelppstrongEducationstrong Bachelors Degree in CS EE or equivalent work experienceppstrongIndustrystrong TelecommunicationsWirelessppstrongLocationstrong Kirkland WA US ppnbspppstrongThe OpportunitystrongppBluetooth technology is the fastest growing wireless technology in the world and the Bluetooth Special Interest Group Bluetooth SIG the company at the heart of the Bluetooth industry is hiringnbspBacked by industryleading companies the Bluetooth SIG oversees the development of new Bluetooth specifications and provides the processes and tools for members to build test qualify and brand their Bluetooth productsppbrppOur collaborative fastpaced company culture and critical role in making the Internet of Things a reality provides you with a unique opportunity to collaborate with the companies that are creating the worlds most advanced products and for you to be a part of the vanguard of technology innovationppbrppAt the Bluetooth SIG our values are at the core of who we are and are displayed on a daily basis as we cultivate relationships with our members business partners and our organization When joining the Bluetooth SIG it means you share and display these values at the highest level collaboration commitment integrity respect humility and creativityppbrppstrongThe RolestrongppThe Bluetooth SIG is seeking a highly motivated individual with both manual and automated testing experiencenbspThe specific role involvespulliVerification testing for preadoption Bluetooth specificationsliliValidation of Bluetooth toolsets for frequent release to the Bluetooth communityliliContinued development enhancement and execution of test automationliulpbrppThe ability to work independently and creatively in an Agile Scrum environment is of paramount importance This position involves working in a fastpaced environment with tight deadlinesppAt the present time this is a hybrid location position with the opportunity to work at home and from the office in Kirkland WA as warrantedppbrppstrongRequirementsstrongpulliBachelors Degree in Computer Science or EngineeringliliAt least 24 years of industry software testing experience with preferred emphasis in wireless protocols hardware or embedded device testingliliAutomation skills in at least one common language C Python JavaliliExperience in designing developing and delivering QA automation testingliliExperience with Microsoft development tools and Azure DevOps for bug and test case tracking coderepositories and CI pipelinesliliGood understanding of the software testing life cycle QA processes and Agile testing methodologyliliTeam Player with a great attitude to execute and deliver testing results to satisfy requirements and release schedulesliliExcellent communications skills both verbal and writtenliliDemonstrated analytical and problemsolving skills with the ability to debug analyze and communicate failuresliliPassion for quality in solving complex software development problemsliliA driven problem solver with strong organizational and analytical skills with attention to detailliliCandidate must be located in the Puget Sound region with the ability to be in the office on days when job functions warrantliulpbrppstrongBonus Points forstrongpulliExperience with or knowledge of Bluetooth tools protocols and architectureliliExperience with one or more test automation tools such as Selenium JMeter FlaUI or TestCafeliliKnowledge of and ability to write PowerShell scripts to automate setup of test environments and execution of automated testsliulpbrppstrongJob ResponsibilitiesstrongpulliAbility to work and deliver results on an Agile Scrum Engineering team as well as an individuallyliliRead and understand Bluetooth specifications and requirements prior to adoption execute manual verification tests report and track failures regression testing of fixesliliWriting and executing test cases and scenarios to verify tools functionalityliliUse of Bluetooth hardware devices to help validate tools and specificationsliliFrequent release testing of our toolsliliDeveloping and contributing to our automation footprintliliVerification of member reported issues and resolutionsliliDevelops and uses working knowledge of the products and tools along with strong customer empathy to contribute to feature designsliliProvides feedback on the product design and vision in planning meetings and postmortemsliliContributes to and maintains automation tools and CI automation pipelinesliliConsiders diagnosability reliability and maintainability in test automation and understands when his or her code is ready to be shared and deliveredliliExposes test coverage issues and implements functional and nonfunctional tests that identify gaps in integration and boundaries and broad problem areasliliPresents conclusions to Engineering peers that fully describe defects their impact to feature areas customer scenarios and quality targetsliliHas a sense of pride and personal accountability for the endtoend productservice quality completeness and resulting user experienceliliIncorporates software quality best practices into their daily tasksliliUsing agile methodology the ability to break down and estimate new engineering work that includes ensuring a high quality barliliHelps define his or her own role in the delivery of the productsliulpbrppThe Bluetooth SIG offers an excellent benefits package including health prescription drug shortterm and longterm disability vision and dental coverage life insurance and 401kppnbspppstrongEqual Employment OpportunitystrongppbrppBluetooth SIG Inc is committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all employees and applicants for employmentnbspNo employee or applicant shall be discriminated against on the basis of race religion color sex age national origin veteran status disability sexual orientation National Guard or reserve unit obligation or any other characteristic protected by lawnbspConsistent with applicable federal and state law Bluetooth SIG Inc will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of qualified applicants or employees unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on the CompanynbspA reasonable accommodation is any modification or adjustment to a job employment practice or the work environment that makes it possible for an individual with a disability to enjoy an equal employment opportunitynbspThis policy applies to all aspects of employment including but not limited to selection job assignment compensation discipline termination and access to benefits and trainingnbspppp
